body_html:
Well, an underscore prefix has meant "not part of public API" (and tensorflow uses device for roughly what we are using it for now).

I'm not really a fan of using of instead of as, because it doesn't match the rest of our API, i.e. the function name is type_as not type_of.
body_text:
Well, an underscore prefix has meant "not part of public API" (and tensorflow uses device for roughly what we are using it for now).
I'm not really a fan of using of instead of as, because it doesn't match the rest of our API, i.e. the function name is type_as not type_of.
body:
Well, an underscore prefix has meant "not part of public API" (and tensorflow uses `device` for roughly what we are using it for now).

I'm not really a fan of using `of` instead of `as`, because it doesn't match the rest of our API, i.e. the function name is `type_as` not `type_of`.
